CACTI: Chromatin QTL Mapping with Peak Windows

Source: R/cacti-package.R
cacti.Rd

The cacti package implements the CACTI peak-window method for chromatin QTL mapping. It is designed to:

Details

  • group nearby peaks into non-overlapping genomic windows,

  • residualize peak intensities with respect to covariates,

  • run multi-peak association tests using a principal-component omnibus (PCO) test, and

  • aggregate per-chromosome results and compute window-level FDR.

The main user-facing functions are:

  • cacti_run_chr: run the peak-window pipeline for a single chromosome.

  • cacti_run_genome: run the peak-window pipeline across multiple chromosomes and add FDR.

Lower-level building blocks:

  • cacti_group_peak_window: group peaks into non-overlapping windows.

  • cacti_pheno_cov_residual: residualize phenotypes by covariates.

  • cacti_cal_p: run CACTI association tests on peak windows.

  • cacti_add_fdr: compute window-level FDR across chromosomes.

A small toy dataset from Aracena et al. is bundled under inst/extdata/ and can be accessed using system.file for testing and examples.

For an overview of the peak-window pipeline and file formats, see the package vignette:

browseVignettes("cacti")

Author

Maintainer: Lili Wang liliw1@uchicago.edu
